p: Materials (kept in 70% alcohol) from Zosima absinthifolia were assessed by light microscopy using Sartur and chloral hydrate reagents. In the light microscopy study, cross-sections of peduncles, rays, pedicels, and fruits from Z. absinthifolia were prepared manually. Images prepared with Sartur R [ 47, 48] were recorded with a Zeiss 51425 camera attached to a light microscope (Zeiss 415500-1800-000). In the scanning electron microscopy (SEM) investigations, leaf, stem, pedicel and fruit parts were attached to aluminium stubs and covered with gold for 4 min in a sputter-coater. Morphological observations were done in a Jeol JSM 6490LV scanning electron microscope at the Turkish Petroleum International Company (TPAO) Research Centre SEM laboratory, Ankara.
